intro: Cinchona remyana, commonly known as the Remyana quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, particularly the production of quinine, which has been historically used to treat malaria. Its bark contains alkaloids that contribute to its pharmacological significance. Cinchona remyana typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations.
